title: Haute-Savoie. En conflit avec ses voisins, il met le feu à leur maison

Haute-Savoie En conflit avec ses voisins, il met le feu à leur maison
« Le drame » qu’a vécu cette famille est encore présent, et les larmes affleurent rapidement. 14 février 2024. Cette famille qui s’est installée dans une ancienne ferme familiale à Groisy, il y a tout juste un an, est de sortie au plateau des Glières, avec leurs trois jeunes enfants, et leurs chiens. À leur retour, en fin de journée, elle découvre, en ouvrant la porte de leur maison, leur chaton mort sur le sol, et plusieurs départs de feu dans l’escalier, le salon et la...
Au sommaire du dossier

author: jeanette-bent
title: King City council votes to adopt a riverbed wildfire prevention plan
text:
King City King City council votes to adopt a riverbed wildfire prevention plan By Jeanette Bent New Published March 12, 2025 4:05 PM KING CITY, Calif. (KION-TV) -- The King City council met Tuesday and unanimously approved to adopt a riverbed wildfire prevention plan as-is.
"King City is at risk from potentially catastrophic wildfire as designated by CAL FIRE’s 2019 Communities at Risk List," according to the city. "For most of the Project Area, the fertility of the soils, availability of shallow groundwater, frequency of major flood disturbances, abundance of noxious weeds, and absentee landownership all work together to create vegetation conditions which are extremely difficult or impractical to manage."
The plan was proposed by the Planning Commission and recommended that City Council review the attached 400-page-plus document accompanying the agenda item to help analyze and reduce wildfire hazards along the Salinas River and San Lorenzo Creek.
"In the past five years, there have been four fires ignited and spread through or near the Project Area," wrote the document . "There is a recent history of people living within the Riverbed area. Multiple individuals and some families had constructed shelters, notably under the 101 overpass and south of the restaurants near the King City/Broadway southbound off ramp, plus some along the river itself."
These areas were the Circle Fire from 2020 (the cause was from a person playing with fire), the Jolon Fire from 2021 (the cause was from equipment use), the King Fire from 2022 (the cause was from an arson that resulted in a death) and the Broadway Fire from 2024 (the cause was from an encampment's cooking fire), according to the city.
A number of agencies along with further recommendations and education were brought up in consideration of the new plan. The 405-page city document can be accessed here .
Article Topic Follows: King City king city king city council king city riverbed wildfire plan monterey county Jump to comments ↓

ई-अटेंडेंस व्यवस्था का प्रांतीय शिक्षक संघ ने किया विरोध, जानिए क्या है E-Attendance Rule
Edited By meena, Updated: 26 Jun, 2025 05:03 PM
मध्य प्रदेश स्कूल शिक्षा विभाग ने शिक्षकों की उपस्थिति के लिए एक नई व्यवस्था लागू की है...
भोपाल (इजहार हसन) : मध्य प्रदेश स्कूल शिक्षा विभाग ने शिक्षकों की उपस्थिति के लिए एक नई व्यवस्था लागू की है। इस व्यवस्था के तहत शिक्षकों को स्कूल पहुंचकर सेल्फी लेनी होगी और उसे निर्धारित पोर्टल पर अपलोड करना होगा। इस प्रक्रिया में उनकी लोकेशन भी दर्ज होगी। साथ ही, स्कूल के समय के बाद भी शिक्षकों को इसी तरह अपनी उपस्थिति दर्ज करानी होगी। यह नया उपस्थिति नियम 1 जुलाई से अनिवार्य कर दिया गया हैं।
वहीं प्रांतीय शिक्षक संघ मध्य प्रदेश ने शिक्षकों की ई-अटेंडेंस का विरोध किया है। संघ के भोपाल संभाग अध्यक्ष शाहिद ख़ान का कहना है कि ग्रामीण इलाकों में इंटरनेट और मोबाइल की समस्या के चलते प्रांतीय शिक्षक संघ e-attendance का विरोध कर रहा है।

संघ का कहना है कि कई शिक्षक ऐसी जगहों पर पढ़ाने जाते हैं जहां पहुंचने में जद्दोदहद करना पड़ती है। नेटवर्क भी नहीं मिलता है। ऐसे में ई अटेंडेंस नहीं लगने पर उनका वेतन कट जाएगा और उनको आर्थिक हानि होगी। ख़ान ने प्रदेश के स्कूल शिक्षा मंत्री और विभागीय कमिश्नर को इस आशय का पत्र लिखकर संघ की मंशा से अवगत करा दिया है। मांग नहीं माने जाने पर आंदोलन की बात कही गई है।

मेष राशि वालों आज का दिन आपके लिए शुभ रहने वाला है। परिवार के साथ किसी धार्मिक स्थान पर जाने का प्लान बना सकते हैं।
वृष राशि वालों आज का दिन आपके लिए ऊर्जा से भरपूर रहेगा । कार्यक्षेत्र में प्रयास सफल होंगे। किसी दोस्त के घर दावत पर जा सकते हैं।
मिथुन राशि वालों आज का दिन आपके लिए खास रहने वाला है। रुके हुए कार्य पूरे होंगे। धन लाभ होने की संभावना है।
कर्क राशि वालों आज का दिन आपके लिए शानदार रहने वाला है। बिजनेस कर रहे लोगों के काम में तेजी आएगी और नए अवसर मिलेंगे।
सिंह राशि वालों आज का दिन आपके लिए मिलाजुला रहेगा । परिवार के किसी सदस्य को आपकी कोई बात बुरी लग सकती है।
कन्या राशि आज का दिन आपके लिए शानदार रहने वाला है। नौकरीपेशा लोगों को प्रमोशन मिलने की संभावना है।
तुला राशि वालों आज का दिन आपके लिए ठीक-ठाक रहने वाला है। मीडिया से जुड़े लोगों की सैलरी में इजाफा हो सकता है।
वृश्चिक राशि वालों आज का दिन आपके लिए सामान्य रहेगा । कोर्ट-कचहरी के मामले में फैसला आपके पक्ष में रहेगा।
धनु राशि वालों आज का दिन आपके लिए अच्छा रहेगा। नौकरीपेशा लोग आज अपने काम में पूरी मेहनत और लगन दिखाएंगे।
मकर राशि वालों आज का दिन आपके लिए बाकी दिनों के मुकाबले अच्छा रहने वाला है। परिवार और रिश्तों में सुख मिलेगा।
कुंभ राशि वालों आज का दिन आपके लिए बढ़िया रहेगा। इस राशि के युवाओं का मन शांत रहेगा। किसी धार्मिक या आध्यात्मिक कार्य में रुचि बढ़ेगी।
मीन राशि वालों आज का दिन आपके लिए उतार-चढ़ाव भरा रहने वाला है। किसी बात को लेकर अधिकारियों के साथ बहस हो सकती है।

author: JAMES PENTLAND
title: Holyoke low-carbon cement startup strikes deal for Vineyard Wind 2
text: Holyoke low-carbon cement startup strikes deal for Vineyard Wind 2 |Published: 07-18-2024 5:06 PM| NORTHAMPTON — Sublime Systems Inc. has announced an agreement to reserve 2,000 tons of its low-carbon cement for use in Vineyard Offshore’s planned wind farm. The reservation agreement depends on state approval of the company’s 1,200-megawatt Vineyard Wind 2 project in three states, but both parties were eager to announce the deal this week and hailed its potential benefits. “We are honored to welcome Vineyard Offshore as a future customer of Sublime Systems, as the proliferation of clean energy inspired our founding and mission to decarbonize cement,” Sublime founder and CEO Leah Ellis said in a statement. “This substantial order, contingent on award of the Vineyard Wind 2 project, will aid in seeding clean energy manufacturing in Massachusetts.” Under the agreement, 2,000 tons of cement from Sublime’s nascent Holyoke manufacturing plant would be used in working platforms on turbines and onshore civil works, reducing the carbon footprint of the Vineyard Wind 2 project. “We reserve a certain volume, for which we know what the price will be,” said Zach Fuerst, Vineyard Offshore’s business development director. Both projects are in the early stages, but Sublime’s target opening of 2026 should position it to be ready to fulfill the order when it’s needed, according to Joe Hicken, Sublime’s vice president of business development and policy. Vineyard Offshore is soliciting power contracts for Vineyard Wind 2 with Connecticut, Rhode Island and Massachusetts. Approval by any of the states would put the project in gear, with construction expected to begin in 2027 and run through 2031, according to Fuerst. Hicken is in charge of scouting future customers for the company’s cement, but he said Vineyard Offshore broached the idea after learning about Sublime’s innovative product. Article continues after... Yesterday's Most Read Articles “As they are a developer of ultra-low-carbon cement, we thought it would be a natural partnership,” Fuerst said. “We want to invest in making Massachusetts a cleantech innovation hub of the world.” The wind-power developer’s goals are to reinforce the clean energy ecosystem in Massachusetts at the same time as it lowers its own carbon footprint, which includes embodied carbon in its infrastructure, Hicken said. Hicken said he had met recently with Energy and Environmental Affairs Secretary Rebecca Tepper, and it was clear that wind-power development “is a huge priority for the Healey administration.” Mixed with water, sand and gravel, cement is used to make concrete, one of the most widely used substances on the planet. Production of cement, commonly made by decomposing limestone at extremely high temperatures, accounts for roughly 8% of global greenhouse gas emissions. The cement sector is the third-largest industrial source of pollution in the U.S., according to the Environmental Protection Agency. Sublime uses an electrochemical process that entirely bypasses the need for extreme heat and limestone in the traditional method of producing cement. The process extracts reactive calcium and silicates from non-carbonate rocks at ambient temperature. The Somerville company, whose pilot plant can produce up to 250 tons of cement a year, announced in January that it had signed a lease-to-own agreement for a 16-acre former industrial property on Water Street in Holyoke, where it would build its new manufacturing plant. Sublime expects the plant to produce 30,000 tons of cement annually and provide at least 70 jobs. The goal is for hiring to begin in the middle of next year and for the factory to be up and running by the first quarter of 2026. Vineyard Offshore stated that it expects to invest $3 million to drive innovation in the offshore wind industry in support of the Healey administration’s goal of making Massachusetts a climate innovation lab for the world. “Offshore wind is a cornerstone of Massachusetts’ clean energy leadership, and we are proud to support the state’s continued leadership with investments in climate innovation in our next project,” Vineyard Offshore CEO Alicia Barton said in a statement. Vineyard Offshore is the American arm of Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners, a Danish renewable energy developer that is a co-owner of the wind farm along with Avangrid Renewables LLC, an American subsidiary of Spanish utility Iberdrola. Vineyard Wind 1, which began producing energy in the winter, is the nation’s first commercial-scale offshore wind energy project. It is more than 15 miles off the coast of Massachusetts, south of Martha’s Vineyard. The operators announced three weeks ago that Vineyard Wind 1 was delivering more than 136 megawatts to the electric grid in Massachusetts, making it the largest operating offshore wind farm in the U.S. Its goal is to produce 806 megawatts, enough to power 400,000 homes and businesses. The wind farm suffered a setback last weekend, however, when part of a 351-foot blade on one of the turbines sheared off, casting debris into the ocean, in what Vineyard Wind called a “blade damage incident.” More of the blade dropped off Thursday. The federal Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement has ordered the company to suspend operations while the incident is investigated. Nantucket’s south-facing beaches were closed to swimming for a day due to floating debris and sharp fiberglass shards washing up on shore. The company said it had mobilized cleanup teams to recover the debris. GE, which manufactured and installed the turbines and blades, was working on determining the root cause, it said.James Pentland can be reached at jpentland@gazettenet.com.

author: Guest
title: Diane Salmon
text:
Diane Salmon, 70
November 8, 1953 - December 27, 2023
STOCKHAM — Diane Salmon, 70, of Stockham, passed away unexpectedly Wednesday, December 27, 2023, in Aurora, Nebraska.
Funeral services will be at 10:30 a.m. Tuesday, January 2, 2024, at the Stockham Community Church in Stockham. Pastors Murray Jones and Clayton Kliewer will officiate. Interment will be in Stockham Cemetery.
Visitation will be from 4 to 6 p.m. Monday at the church. Memorials may be made to the family to designate at a later date.
Condolences may be emailed to the family through the mortuary website at
www.higbymortuary.com
Those left to cherish her memory are her husband, Lonnie, of Stockham; a daughter, Kerry (Randy) Slaymaker of Kearney, Nebraska; a son, Colt (Jasmin) Salmon of Sutton, Nebraska; three grandchildren, Kensley and Kaden Slaymaker of Kearney, and Zoe Salmon of Sutton; two sisters, Linette (Murray) Jones of Holdrege, Nebraska, and Carol (David) Holl of Kearney; two brothers, Orin (Janet) Kliewer of Aurora, and Berdon (Vivian) Kliewer of Stockham; two sisters-in-law, Helen Kliewer of Stockham and Mickey Kliewer of Wymore, Nebraska; three brothers-in-law, Doug (Karen) Tessman, Richard (Cheryl) Heftie of Stockham, and Dennis (Vicki) Salmon of Hastings, Nebraska; as well as a host of nieces, nephews, extended family and friends.

author: tio.ch
title: \u00abUn terzo dei dipendenti \u00e8 sotto stress\u00bb
text:
Il barometro di Travail.Suisse fotografa una situazione del mondo del lavoro inquietante.
BERNA - In Svizzera la percentuale di dipendenti costantemente sull'orlo dell'esaurimento è ai massimi storici: si parla di uno su tre. È quanto emerge dal "Barometro delle condizioni di lavoro", un'indagine condotta annualmente dal sindacato Travail.Suisse in collaborazione con la Scuola universitaria professionale di Berna (BFH) i cui risultati sono stati presentati oggi alla stampa.
L'associazione di categoria ha lanciato l'allarme: la percentuale di dipendenti altamente stressati è in costante aumento e l'esaurimento si sta diffondendo, il che significa che lo stress è diventato il problema più grande nel mondo del lavoro negli ultimi anni.
La stragrande maggioranza dei dipendenti, l'84,2%, risulta essere occasionalmente troppo stanca dopo il lavoro per occuparsi di questioni private o familiari; per più di uno su tre ciò accade spesso o molto spesso, condizione quantificata da Travail.Suisse come equivalente a un esaurimento permanente.
Per questo motivo, "la lotta allo stress deve diventare una priorità politica assoluta", ha enfatizzato la vicepresidente del sindacato e consigliera nazionale Léonore Porchet (Verdi/VD).
Travail.Suisse ha attirato l'attenzione anche sulla situazione dei dipendenti con problemi di salute: secondo il barometro, una persona su tre è affetta da disturbi e circa la metà si sente limitata nel lavoro.
Colpisce il fatto che, anche tra i dipendenti che lamentano gravi disturbi, più di due terzi non hanno avuto un adattamento dei propri compiti o del luogo di lavoro, sottolinea il sindacato. Di conseguenza, queste persone valutano la qualità delle condizioni di lavoro in modo costantemente peggiore rispetto ai loro colleghi sani.
Più sostegno alla formazione continua
Per contro - è stato sottolineato davanti alla stampa - si registrano sviluppi positivi nell'ambito della formazione continua, con un maggiore impegno da parte dei datori di lavoro nel promuovere la formazione continua, anche se con grandi differenze a seconda delle dimensioni dell'azienda e del livello di occupazione dei dipendenti.
Secondo Travail.Suisse, tuttavia, la percentuale di copertura dei costi da parte dei datori di lavoro non è cambiata: quasi la metà dei dipendenti non riceve alcun sostegno finanziario, o lo riceve solo in parte, per i propri sforzi formativi.
"È necessaria un'ulteriore campagna in favore della di formazione e il sostegno ai costi diretti e indiretti deve essere ampliato", ha detto Adrian Wüthrich, presidente di Travail.Suisse.
Il sondaggio, ha indicato il sindacato, è stato effettuato diversi mesi fa. Per realizzarlo sono stati sollecitati circa 1400 impiegati rappresentativi del mercato del lavoro elvetico e provenienti da tutte le regioni.

author: Amanda Gokee
title: This man is running across N.H. to raise awareness about hunger
text:
In just a few weeks, Matty Gregg will lace up his running shoes and embark on a run across the entire state of New Hampshire.
The route starts in his hometown of Nashua and winds its way up to Manchester, Concord, North Conway, and Gorham. Then, it’s on to the home stretch, passing through Colebrook and Pittsburg on the way to the Canadian border.
The 46-year-old seasoned runner has completed ultra-marathons, 100-mile runs, 24-hour Tough Mudders and, in 2018, even spent nine months running 5,425 miles across the country.
He’s also feeling confident about the New Hampshire run, estimated to be a mere 230 miles, because he’s doing it for a cause he believes in — raising awareness about hunger and raising money for the anti-hunger nonprofit New Hampshire Hunger Solutions .
Advertisement
According to data from the nonprofit , about 45 percent of adults in the state and 46 percent of children have insufficient food, which includes those who can’t always afford to buy the kinds of food they want.
Get N.H. Morning Report A weekday newsletter delivering the N.H. news you need to know right to your inbox. Enter Email Sign Up Gregg said more awareness is needed to bolster support for legislative efforts, after an effort to expand free and reduced-price lunch failed earlier this year .
“With the events that we’re doing all the way from Nashua to Canada, we should be able to show and highlight how big of a problem this actually is,” he said.
Gregg said he started running as a kid when he would race his dad at the Nashua High School track. It wasn’t until 2013 that he started running major distances, and he’d use the runs to raise money for a cause.
“I was never going to be the fastest one out there,” he said, “but I wanted to raise the most money for charity.”
He found the mental challenge even greater than the physical one, and said it taught him how to set tiny goals and to take the runs one step at a time.
Starting Oct. 3, he plans to run about 30 miles per day, averaging 10- to 13-minute miles, with the goal of completing the run on Oct 10.
Gregg said his wife and daughter will be there to support him along the way, driving ahead to scout the way and providing him with snacks, water, and encouragement. They plan to drive back to Nashua each night, until they reach North Conway, when they’ll start staying at North Country hotels.
Advertisement

author: @14News
title: Burdette Park closed starting Friday due to flooding
text:
Burdette Park closed starting Friday due to flooding
VANDERBURGH CO., Ind. (WFIE) - Vanderburgh County Commissioners say Burdette Park and the surrounding areas are experiencing severe flooding.
They say the river is expected to crest at around 48 feet, which is the highest it’s been since 1945.
Right now, the main entrance and exit at Burdette Park is now closed because of high water.
Officials say Nurrenbern Road is expected to become impassable by the end of Wednesday.
They say for the time being, employees and guests should use the west entrance at the back of the park.
However, starting Friday, Burdette Park will be closed to the public until further notice, including all scheduled events.
“Our top priority is the safety and well-being of our guests and staff,” said Park Director, Zach Wathen. “We will continue to work closely with the Vanderburgh County Commissioners and keep the public informed as the situation develops.”

author: Impremedia
title: Horóscopo de hoy de El Niño Prodigio 2 junio de 2024
text:
El Niño Prodigio es el nombre por el cual se conoce a Víctor Florencio, un destacado vidente y astrólogo dominicano. Este es el horóscopo de hoy, 2 de junio de 2024.
Aries 03/21 – 04/19
Tu mente y tu instinto se potenciarán en una danza asombrosa. Estarás rodeado de personas ingeniosas que compartirán opiniones interesantes contigo. Este es el momento perfecto para que tu liderazgo brille; escucha atentamente a los demás antes de tomar decisiones.
Tauro 04/20 – 05/20
Es posible que algunas de tus preocupaciones financieras sean fruto de temores infundados. Sin embargo, quiero asegurarte de que se presentarán oportunidades para hacer frente a tus gastos y saldar tus deudas. Te animo a que te conectes con tu fuerza interior y agradezcas a la providencia.
Géminis 05/21 – 06/20
Sentirás una poderosa necesidad de tomar más protagonismo y compartir con los demás. Es el momento perfecto para brillar, poner en acción esas ideas que has estado gestando y luchar por tus convicciones. Tu carisma y pasión generarán un gran impacto en tu círculo social.
Cáncer 06/21 – 07/20
Hoy es el momento ideal para que tomes el control de tu vida, con la certeza de que tu alma, tus guías espirituales y el universo están trabajando en tu favor. Tienes el poder de avanzar y alcanzar tus metas. ¡No dudes en actuar y destacar en tu carrera profesional!
Leo 07/21 – 08/21
¡Si estás preparando una nueva hazaña o aventura, prepárate para celebrar porque habrá avances notables! Confía en tu instinto y déjate llevar por esa energía audaz que te motiva a explorar nuevas oportunidades. ¡El mundo está ansioso por que lo descubras!
Virgo 08/22 – 09/22
Tus ambiciones se intensificarán y estarás listo para emprender una batalla para transformar tu situación financiera. Además, contarás con el respaldo de un cómplice influyente, poderoso y carismático que te ayudará a alcanzar tus objetivos. Demostrarás rapidez y astucia en tus negociaciones.
Libra 09/23 – 10/22
Hoy puede marcar el inicio de una nueva y hermosa historia de amor, ya sea con tu pareja actual o con alguien especial que llegará a tu vida. Si estás soltero, es posible un enamoramiento con alguien de otras regiones. El fuego del romance arderá con intensidad, sin importar las distancias.
Escorpio 10/23 – 11/22
Renueva tu ser encendiendo la chispa de la salud. Deshazte de los hábitos tóxicos que minan tu bienestar y reactiva tu cuerpo, convirtiéndolo en tu propio sistema solar de energía vibrante. No omitas tus chequeos médicos, es momento de cuidarte con esmero.
Sagitario 11/23 – 12/20
Te conectarás con ese toque único y especial donde reside tu fuerza y creatividad, despertando pasiones. Permítele a tu ser brillar y deja que la luz del amor ilumine tu camino como una antorcha. Aquel ser que tanto te interesa responderá de manera positiva.
Capricornio 12/21 – 01/19
Estarás lleno de ímpetu para implementar cambios en tu hogar. Pensarás en cómo optimizar el espacio y lograr una mejor circulación. Considera reservar un lugar para hacer ejercicio, tal vez incorporando una bicicleta fija. Tu casa puede convertirse en un espacio que potencie tu bienestar.
Acuario 01/20 – 02/18
Hoy, bajo la influencia de la venerada luna, tus ideas se encenderán con un fuego renovador, abriendo nuevas vías de comunicación. Tu mente brillará con una gracia singular y tus palabras inspirarán a todos los que te escuchen. ¡Exprésate con alegría y comparte tu pasión!
Piscis 02/19 – 03/20
Hoy, tu enfoque estará en tu economía y actuarás en consecuencia. Sentirás el impulso de compartir tu prosperidad con tus seres queridos y ofrecerles lo mejor. Sería prudente considerar invertir tu dinero en mejorar tu hogar o en negocios relacionados con bienes inmuebles.
